How can I lock a VerusID using the command line interface of Verus Desktop?

You can lock a VerusID by running the `updateidentity` command with the necessary parameters. Here's an example:
```json
run updateidentity 
'{ 
  "name":"youridentityname",
  "minimumsignatures":1,
  "primaryaddresses":["primary-address-comes-here"],
  "flags":2,
  "timelock":10080
  }'
```
This command locks the VerusID with a DelayLock, which requires a certain number of blocks to pass before the funds can be spent again.

``` json
run updateidentity 
'{ 
  "name":"youridentityname",
  "minimumsignatures":1,
  "primaryaddresses":["primary-address-comes-here"],
  "flags":2,
  "timelock":10080
  }'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs. In the code snippet are the minimum requirements to update your VerusID with a lock.

:::tip Revoke & Recover
Remember: you can always revoke and recover a locked VerusID.
:::

### Request an unlock
Above you locked a VerusID with a DelayLock. Now let's request an unlock. When an unlock has been requested you have to wait the predetermined number of blocks before you can spend the funds again.

Fill in your VerusID ``name``, the ``primary address`` and set ``flags`` to 0. Now you only have to wait for your predetermined number of blocks (10,080 in our example) to run out so you can spend the funds again.

``` json
run updateidentity 
'{ 
  "name":"youridentityname",
  "minimumsignatures":1,
  "primaryaddresses":["primary-address-comes-here"],
  "flags":0
  }'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs. In the code snippet are the minimum requirements to unlock your VerusID.
What happens if I lock a VerusID and want to regain access to the funds?

If you lock a VerusID, you can always revoke and recover it. Additionally, you can request an unlock by updating the identity with the necessary parameters, such as setting `flags` to 0. After requesting an unlock, you need to wait for the predetermined number of blocks to pass before you can spend the funds again.

``` json
run updateidentity 
'{ 
  "name":"youridentityname",
  "minimumsignatures":1,
  "primaryaddresses":["primary-address-comes-here"],
  "flags":2,
  "timelock":10080
  }'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs. In the code snippet are the minimum requirements to update your VerusID with a lock.

:::tip Revoke & Recover
Remember: you can always revoke and recover a locked VerusID.
:::

### Request an unlock
Above you locked a VerusID with a DelayLock. Now let's request an unlock. When an unlock has been requested you have to wait the predetermined number of blocks before you can spend the funds again.

Fill in your VerusID ``name``, the ``primary address`` and set ``flags`` to 0. Now you only have to wait for your predetermined number of blocks (10,080 in our example) to run out so you can spend the funds again.

``` json
run updateidentity 
'{ 
  "name":"youridentityname",
  "minimumsignatures":1,
  "primaryaddresses":["primary-address-comes-here"],
  "flags":0
  }'
```

You can copy and paste this code snippet into the commandline interface of Verus Desktop and edit the necessary inputs for your needs. In the code snippet are the minimum requirements to unlock your VerusID.
How do I request an unlock for a locked VerusID?

```json
  "name":"youridentityname",

  "flags":0
```

``` json

  "name":"youridentityname",
```

Above you locked a VerusID with a DelayLock. Now let's request an unlock. When an unlock has been requested you have to wait the predetermined number of blocks before you can spend the funds again.

``` json
run updateidentity 
'{ 
  "name":"youridentityname",
```
